docs.lead_paragraph: Washington, the only state ever to have legalized abortion through a popular vote, is now debating a law that would require health insurers to pay for an elective abortion.

headline.seo: Washington State Abortion Debate Counters the Trend
headline.main: In Washington, Abortion Debate Counters Trend
headline.print_headline: In Washington, Abortion Debate Counters Trend

docs.abstract: Washington, already nation's only state ever to have legalized abortion through popular vote, is now debating law that would require health insurers to pay for elective abortion.
docs.snippet: Washington, the only state ever to have legalized abortion through a popular vote, is now debating a law that would require health insurers to pay for an elective abortion.

keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)
keywords.name: subject

docs.lead_paragraph: Because of what the Obama administration called “operational challenges,” most small companies that buy insurance through an exchange will offer workers just one option next year.

headline.seo: Health Law Provision for Small Business Is Delayed
headline.main: Small Firms’ Offer of Plan Choices Under Health Law Delayed
headline.print_headline: U.S. Delays Health Law Provision Offering Small Businesses a Choice of Plans

docs.abstract: Obama administration is delaying parts of program intended to provide affordable health insurance to small businesses and their employees, major selling point for health care legislation; because of what administration calls 'operational challenges,' most small companies that buy insurance through an exchange will offer workers just one option.
docs.snippet: Because of what the Obama administration called “operational challenges,” most small companies that buy insurance through an exchange will offer workers just one option next year.

keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)
keywords.name: subject

docs.abstract: A summary of what’s on today’s editorial page.
docs.snippet: A summary of what’s on today’s editorial page.

docs.lead_paragraph: There are major benefits and big risks in what some Republican-led states want to do.

headline.seo: Using Medicaid Dollars for Private Insurance
headline.main: Using Medicaid Dollars for Private Insurance
headline.print_headline: Using Medicaid Dollars for Private Insurance

docs.abstract: Editorial underlines both benefits and risks to Republican officials' plans in some states to redirect federal money intended to expand Medicaid and use it instead to buy private health insurance for Medicaid recipients; urges federal officials to enforce strict conditions before agreeing to any redirection of Medicaid dollars.
docs.snippet: There are major benefits and big risks in what some Republican-led states want to do.

docs.lead_paragraph: Readers react to Dr. Ezekiel J. Emanuel’s suggestions for improving cancer care.
docs.snippet: Readers react to Dr. Ezekiel J. Emanuel’s suggestions for improving cancer care.

docs.lead_paragraph: The rescue of Los Angeles-based IndyMac Bancorp may provide lessons for what the losses required by the Bank of Cyprus bailout will mean.

headline.seo: Calculating Impact of Cyprus’s Bank Bailout
headline.main: Calculating the Impact of Cyprus’s Bailout
headline.print_headline: Calculating the Impact of Cyprus’s Bailout

docs.abstract: News analysis; 2008 bailout of Los Angeles-based savings and loan institution IndyMac Bancorp, which involved 50 percent losses on deposits, offers glimpse of likely fallout from huge investor losses that will be part of Cypriot bailout.
docs.snippet: The rescue of Los Angeles-based IndyMac Bancorp may provide lessons for what the losses required by the Bank of Cyprus bailout will mean.
